## **Problem 1**

Let $A$ and $B$ be two events such that $P(A) = 0.4$, $P(B) = 0.3$, and $P(A \cap B) = 0.2$.

### a. Are $A$ and $B$ independent?

$$
\textcolor{red}{
P(A)P(B) = (0.4)(0.3) = 0.12 \neq P(A \cap B) = 0.2
}
$$

$$
\textcolor{red}{
\text{Therefore, } A \text{ and } B \text{ are not independent.}
}
$$

### b. Find $P(A \mid A \cup B)$

$$
\textcolor{red}{
P(A \mid A \cup B) = \frac{P(A \cap (A \cup B))}{P(A \cup B)}
}
$$

$$
\textcolor{red}{
P(A \cap (A \cup B)) = P(A) = 0.4
}
$$

$$
\textcolor{red}{
P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B) = 0.4 + 0.3 - 0.2 = 0.5
}
$$

$$
\textcolor{red}{
P(A \mid A \cup B) = \frac{0.4}{0.5}
}
$$


## **Problem 2**

An email system uses a spam filter.

- $P(\text{Spam}) = 0.30$
- $P(\text{Flagged} \mid \text{Spam}) = 0.95$
- $P(\text{Flagged} \mid \text{Not Spam}) = 0.03$

Find $P(\text{Spam} \mid \text{Flagged})$.

$$
\textcolor{red}{
P(\text{Spam} \mid \text{Flagged}) =
\frac{P(\text{Flagged} \mid \text{Spam})P(\text{Spam})}
{P(\text{Flagged} \mid \text{Spam})P(\text{Spam}) + P(\text{Flagged} \mid \text{Not Spam})P(\text{Not Spam})}
}
$$

$$
\textcolor{red}{
= \frac{(0.95)(0.30)}{(0.95)(0.30) + (0.03)(0.70)}
}
$$
